 Yeah, I've heard that stuff. It's like expecting every word out my boxes =
to be absolute truth, when in fact there is much that is deceptive, and nor=
mal bits of speech mis-interpreted. I don't expect absolute truth in anythi=
ng human, I don't think it's possible. 
 
 Those miners were a live for a t=
ime, they said they could feel air movement at one point point from those h=
oles that were drilled---before they died! And no, I can't prove I heard th=
at in my recordings either. 
 
 Frank

 Yeah, I've heard that stuff. It's like expecting every wo=
rd out my boxes to be absolute truth, when in fact there is much that is de=
ceptive, and normal bits of speech mis-interpreted. I don't expect absolute=
 truth in anything human, I don't think it's possible. <BR>
 <BR>
&nbs=
p;Those miners were a live for a time, they said they could feel air moveme=
nt at one point point from those holes that were drilled---before they died=
! And no, I can't prove I heard that in my recordings either. <BR>
 <B=
R>
 Frank<BR><BR>
